# Thousands of models contributed by our community
All the latest models are on Replicate. They’re not just demos — they all actually work and have production-ready APIs.
AI shouldn’t be locked up inside academic papers and demos. Make it real by pushing it to Replicate.
[Explore models](https://replicate.com/<https:/replicate.com/explore>)

# How it works
You can get started with any model with just one line of code. But as you do more complex things, you fine-tune models or deploy your own custom code.
## Run models
Our community has already published thousands of models that are ready to use in production. You can run these with one line of code.
[Explore models](https://replicate.com/<https:/replicate.com/explore>)
```
import replicate
```
```
output = replicate.run(
```
```
 "black-forest-labs/flux-dev",
```
```
 input={
```
```
  "aspect_ratio": "1:1",
```
```
  "num_outputs": 1,
```
```
  "output_format": "jpg",
```
```
  "output_quality": 80,
```
```
  "prompt": "An astronaut riding a rainbow unicorn, cinematic, dramatic",
```
```
 }
```
```
)
```
```
print(output)
```

## Fine-tune models with your own data
You can improve models with your own data to create new models that are better suited to specific tasks.
Image models like SDXL can generate images of a particular person, object, or style.
[Fine-tune image models](https://replicate.com/<https:/replicate.com/docs/guides/fine-tune-an-image-model>)
Train a model:
```
training = replicate.trainings.create(
```
```
 destination="mattrothenberg/drone-art"
```

## Deploy custom models
You aren’t limited to the models on Replicate: you can deploy your own custom models using [Cog](https://replicate.com/<https:/github.com/replicate/cog>), our open-source tool for packaging machine learning models.
Cog takes care of generating an API server and deploying it on a big cluster in the cloud. We scale up and down to handle demand, and you only pay for the compute that you use.
[Learn more](https://replicate.com/<https:/replicate.com/docs/guides/deploy-a-custom-model>)
First, define the environment your model runs in with cog.yaml:
```
build:
```
```
 gpu: true
```
```
 system_packages:
```
```
  - "libgl1-mesa-glx"
```
```
  - "libglib2.0-0"
```
```
 python_version: "3.10"
```
```
 python_packages:
```
```
  - "torch==1.13.1"
```
```
predict: "predict.py:Predictor"
```

Next, define how predictions are run on your model with predict.py:
```
from cog import BasePredictor, Input, Path
```
```
import torch
```
```
class Predictor(BasePredictor):
```
```
 def setup(self):
```
```
   """Load the model into memory to make running multiple predictions efficient"""
```
```
   self.model = torch.load("./weights.pth")
```
```
 # The arguments and types the model takes as input
```
```
 def predict(self,
```
```
    image: Path = Input(description="Grayscale input image")
```
```
 ) -> Path:
```
```
   """Run a single prediction on the model"""
```
```
   processed_image = preprocess(image)
```
```
   output = self.model(processed_image)
```
```
   return postprocess(output)
```

## Deploy custom models
You aren’t limited to the models on Replicate: you can deploy your own custom models using Cog⟨60⟩, our open-source tool for packaging machine learning models.
Cog takes care of generating an API server and deploying it on a big cluster in the cloud. We scale up and down to handle demand, and you only pay for the compute that you use.
Learn more⟨61⟩
First, define the environment your model runs in with cog.yaml:
```
build:
```
```
 gpu: true
```
```
 system_packages:
```
```
  - "libgl1-mesa-glx"
```
```
  - "libglib2.0-0"
```
```
 python_version: "3.10"
```
```
 python_packages:
```
```
  - "torch==1.13.1"
```
```
predict: "predict.py:Predictor"
```

Next, define how predictions are run on your model with predict.py:
```
from cog import BasePredictor, Input, Path
```
```
import torch
```
```
class Predictor(BasePredictor):
```
```
 def setup(self):
```
```
   """Load the model into memory to make running multiple predictions efficient"""
```
```
   self.model = torch.load("./weights.pth")
```
```
 # The arguments and types the model takes as input
```
```
 def predict(self,
```
```
    image: Path = Input(description="Grayscale input image")
```
```
 ) -> Path:
```
```
   """Run a single prediction on the model"""
```
```
   processed_image = preprocess(image)
```
```
   output = self.model(processed_image)
```
```
   return postprocess(output)
```

generated_description:
**Replicate: Your Cloud for Machine Learning Models**

Replicate is tackling an ambitious mission: to make running machine learning models in the cloud simple and accessible. Founded in 2019 as part of Y Combinator's W20 batch, they’re based in San Francisco and have grown to a team of 27. Their tagline hinges on practical AI usage, stated succinctly as "Run AI with an API".

At Replicate, the emphasis is on community and open-source development. They provide thousands of models from various contributors, offering both production-ready APIs and a platform for pushing new models. Whether you're looking to generate images, fine-tune existing models, or deploy custom models, Replicate enables these capabilities with just a line of code.

### Key Features:
- **Wide-Ranging Functionalities**: You can generate not only images but also videos, speech, and even music. This opens up avenues for diverse applications across different industries.
- **Simplicity**: Users can interact with complex models effortlessly. For example, running a predefined model can be done with a few lines of code, making it friendly for developers of all levels.
- **Scalability and Cost Efficiency**: Replicate’s infrastructure scales automatically based on your demand. This means no unnecessary charges—you're only billed for what you use, right down to the second.
- **Community Contributions**: With a wide assortment of models available from contributors, the platform thrives on innovation. It’s designed so that cutting-edge solutions are not locked away in research papers but made accessible for real-world applications.

### Use Cases:
1. **Creative Applications**: Artists and content creators can leverage high-quality image models to generate unique artworks or enhance existing ones.
2. **Business Tools**: Companies can integrate AI features into their products and services, enhancing their offerings without deep expertise in machine learning.
3. **Research and Development**: Facilitates exploring new methodologies through model experimentation and adaptation.

The Group Partner, Jared Friedman, plays a crucial role in guiding the team's vision and strategy, ensuring Replicate remains at the forefront of AI innovation.

Check out their website at [Replicate.com](https://replicate.com) to explore models, review documentation, or engage in their community. After all, in a world filled with complex technology, Replicate stands out by simplifying access to powerful AI tools, empowering developers and creators alike.
